hero.title: NARA Act & Amendments
hero.headline: Empowering Aquatic Research and Development
hero.description: The National Aquatic Resources Research and Development Agency Act (Act No. 54 of 1981) established NARA as Sri Lanka's premier institute for marine and freshwater research. Through subsequent amendments, including the landmark Act No. 32 of 1996, NARA's mandate has expanded to encompass comprehensive advisory, training, and coordination roles across all aquatic domains.

items.title: Act No. 54 of 1981
items.description: Established NARA as a statutory body following the declaration of Sri Lanka's 200-nautical-mile Exclusive Economic Zone (EEZ), empowering the agency to conduct research, advise policymakers, and coordinate national aquatic resource management efforts.

items.title: Act No. 32 of 1996
items.description: Landmark amendment that significantly expanded NARA's powers and functions, including enhanced advisory roles, training programs, and coordination mechanisms across coastal, inland, and offshore domains.

items.title: Governance Structure
items.description: NARA operates under a Board of Governors appointed by the Minister, ensuring transparent governance, strategic oversight, and alignment with national priorities for sustainable aquatic resource management.

items.title: Core Mandate
items.description: Research and development in oceanography, fisheries, aquaculture, environmental studies, socio-economics, hydrography, and post-harvest technology to support the Blue Economy and sustainable development goals.
